content.title: Patch Angioplasty Technique
content.definition: A surgical technique to widen a stenotic or transected artery by sewing in a patch of graft material or autologous tissue to enlarge the vessel lumen.

clinical_features.endarterectomy: Closure after carotid or femoral endarterectomy
clinical_features.small_vessel: When primary closure would narrow vessel
clinical_features.reconstruction: Repair of arteriotomy in diseased vessels

clinical_features.dacron: Woven or knitted polyester, readily available

clinical_features.sizing: Cut patch to appropriate width (usually 8-10mm at widest)
clinical_features.shaping: Oval or elliptical shape with tapered ends
clinical_features.start_point: Begin at apex, work toward surgeon

clinical_features.cea_evidence: Patch closure reduces restenosis and stroke risk vs primary closure
